intro: Laurembergia engleri, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
